Description: Egyptian glazed composition (Faience) Common Bowl; mould-made and glazed; shallow hemispherical body with a rounded base; made of blue-green glazed composition, decorated with black paint: lotus-design within; vessel complete but composed of seven fragments; glaze and paint is very worn.
Curator's comments: Additional bibliography: Peltenburg E. 2007, 'Hathor, faience and copper on Late Bronze Age Cyprus', CCEC 37, fig. 5b, where this bowl, and other Common bowls found on Cyprus, are discussed in terms of possible Hathoric imagery.
Bibliographic references: Peltenburg 1986 / Ramesside Egypt and Cyprus (p. 158, Common bowl no. 36)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (no. 217)
